label: 玄圃霊三
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: [Kyoto Gozan] monk [appointed by Hideyoshi as his assistants in his diplomatic initiatives].  Monks such as [him] and Seishō Jōtai conducted diplomatic negotiations with China and Korea from about 1591, and they drafted Hideyoshi's letters to the viceroy of the Indies (Portuguese Goa), to the governor general of the Philippines (Spain), and to Takasagun (Taiwan) (p. 69). [五山、秀吉、西笑承兄]
